items.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah says lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against SA premier
items.description: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas following his public commentary about her scheduled appearance at Adelaide Writers' Week.

items.title: 'Moscow on the Torrens': How to lose a writers' week in six days
items.description: The removal and subsequent handling of Randa Abdel-Fattah's rescinded invitation to Adelaide Writers' Week led to the event's cancellation, with more than 180 authors pulling out and its own director issuing a pointed and very public resignation. Where does the festival go from here?

items.title: Bookstores pull Craig Silvey's work in response to child exploitation material charges
items.description: The fallout of the high-profile child exploitation material allegations against Craig Silvey starts to ripple through the literary community, as the renowned author faces charges of possessing and distributing illicit material.

items.title: It is now very likely Trump will order his military option of choice on Iran
items.description: The Iranian regime has done exactly what Donald Trump warned against. Despite the information blackout, it is clear hundreds, if not thousands, of protesters have died and the US president is now likely to order a response, writes John Lyons.

items.title: Tom Silvagni files application to appeal rape conviction
items.description: Lawyers for convicted rapist Tom Silvagni, the son of AFL great Stephen Silvagni and TV personality Jo Silvagni, have filed an application for leave to appeal.

items.title: Rare verified footage of Iran's protests shows how they spread
items.description: The first embers of the Iranian protests started in a mobile phone market, spreading to every corner of the country as the Revolutionary Guard struggled to regain control.

items.title: Minns says Bondi bridge should be torn down, not become 'ghoulish reminder'
items.description: The Bondi Beach footbridge that some locals want removed following last month's terror attack was already going to need replacement for structural reasons.

items.title: 'Victim is terrified': NRLW star facing DV, harassment charges
items.description: Maddison Studdon is accused of harassing her ex-partner as their relationship broke down, culminating in 29 calls and an alleged "throat-slitting" gesture over cheating claims.

items.title: Fires, floods and storms: Our changing climate in pics and graphs
items.description: Extreme heat, droughts, storms and deadly floods challenged resilience not only in Australia, but across the globe.

items.title: Live: Trump unleashes again on 'that jerk' Powell, ASX flat
items.description: The Australian share market flattens after a Wall Street retreat from record highs while global central bank chiefs, including RBA governor Michele Bullock, issue a joint statement backing US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is under criminal investigation. Follow live.

items.title: Indian truckies fed up with racist tirades over their CB radios
items.description: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

items.title: Russia's 'unstoppable' nuclear-capable missile sparks emergency UN meeting
items.description: Analysts say Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic missile will continues to pose challenges for NATO after Moscow used the weapon for a second time in Ukraine.

items.title: Rescued teen craves 'choccy milk' after 50km run lost in mountains
items.description: Bohdi Jackson was meant to complete an 8-kilometre run on Tuesday. After taking a wrong turn, he ended up travelling 50km, sparking a large search.

items.title: Cricket clubrooms reduced to ashes after fire in western Victoria
items.description: Leigh Graham lost his home and his "second home" — his local cricket club's rooms — in the fires that moved through the western Victorian community of Streatham. He still turned up to play two days later.

items.title: Trump says he's in control in Venezuela but these experts say it won't last
items.description: Venezuela is in the hands of both Donald Trump and a regime loyal to its ousted leader. The country's future, including the well-being of its people, is likely to depend on how well Delcy Rodríguez can walk a tightrope between Washington's demands and her coalition's hardliners.

items.title: The man police overlooked in Eloise Worledge disappearance
items.description: As police up the reward to $1 million for information that will lead to the remains of missing school girl Eloise Worledge, questions remain about why police disregarded a known rapist in their investigation.

items.title: Is hyaluronic acid all hype? We look at the science
items.description: While hyaluronic acid is a common component of our skin and tissue and is marketed as a way to boost hydration, its skin benefits are more complicated than it appears.

items.title: From celebrated cartoonist to pariah — Dilbert creator Scott Adams dead at 68
items.description: At its height, Dilbert was syndicated around the world, delighting people with its satirical take on office work before creator Scott Adams began a descent into racism and misogyny.

items.title: Friends pay tribute to carer found dead at house south of Brisbane
items.description: Velvet Pesu was found dead during a police welfare check at a house in the Logan suburb of Buccan.

items.title: Brisbane neurosurgeon charged over alleged medical devices kickback scheme
items.description: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

items.title: Survival tales from flood-hit Clermont as ex-TC Koji recovery begins
items.description: Families in the central Queensland community of Clermont describe the moment they escaped swiftly rising floodwaters triggered by ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

items.title: Thanasi Kokkinakis's hopeful Aus Open warm-up ends with another injury
items.description: Adelaide native Thanasi Kokkinakis withdraws from his home tournament on the eve of the Australian Open after suffering another injury setback in his opening-round win.

items.title: White whale spotted off NSW coast in 'unusual' summer sighting
items.description: Researchers are asking for the public's help to learn more about the health of the albino whale, which was seen from Crescent Head on the Mid North Coast.

items.title: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation
items.description: Republicans in the US House say they could commence contempt of Congress proceedings against the former president and former Democratic presidential nominee.

items.title: 'Number one target' tobacco kingpin Kazem Hamad arrested in Iraq
items.description: Iraqi authorities have confirmed the convicted heroin trafficker and illegal tobacco boss has been arrested for alleged drug importation and smuggling.
